title: BBC Radio 1 stars will get Christmas off while station is staffed by hospital radio DJs
text:
The hosts of BBC Radio 1 will get Christmas off as aspiring DJs are set to take over during the festive period.

The current roster of DJs includes Greg James, Clara Amfo, Nick Grimshaw and Annie Mac but all are set to take a step back.

Instead, the station has issued an appeal for a whole host of new talent to take their place.

The current roster of DJs includes Greg James, who hosts the breakfast show, as well as Clara Amfo who presents the Live Lounge

The successful candidates will get to join the production from Boxing Day until New Year's Eve.

The station is looking for those who have previous experience in community, hospital, student or local radio to submit demos throughout October.

Aled Haydn-Jones, Head of Programmes at BBC Radio 1, said: 'We're passionate at Radio 1 about finding and developing new talent, whether its artists, DJs or presenters.

Nick Grimshaw has hosted a range of Radio 1 shows during his career and Annie Mac now has her own eponymous show

'We're excited to be able to offer this opportunity to give some new young presenters a very public platform to help them establish their footing in the UK radio industry.

'We can't wait to hear who's out there!'

The station has often championed emerging talent such as with its Brit List initiative in which they aim to elevate new talent to bigger platforms.
